metadata.title: CVE-2021-4083 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A read-after-free memory flaw was found in the Linux kernel's garbagecollection for Unix domain socket file handlers in the way users callclose() and fget() simultaneously and can potentially trigger a racecondition. This flaw allows a local user to crash the system or escalatetheir privileges on the system. This flaw affects Linux kernel versionsprior to 5.16-rc4.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
